poem:
### Murmurs in the Halls

Glass shattered,  
a scream like wind through  
Spanish moss—  
red beads scatter  
beneath the harsh sun.  

Memory flickers  
in the unyielding sky,  
whispered names hover  
on pastel tongues—  
waiting rooms full  
of unfinished stories,  

shadows trace  
where laughter once echoed—  
silent now.
